main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tlv

Class TLVUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tlv.TLVUtility

  • public class TLVUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides utility methods that are used in en- and decoding ASN1 byte arrays. It also provides some methods to make byte arrays human-readable so that one gets a hexadecimal (or binary) representation of their content.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Constructor Summary

      private TLVUtility()
      Class only provides static methods, therefore should not be instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • removeSEQUENCEWrapper

        public static TLVObject[] removeSEQUENCEWrapper(TLVObject[] inputWithSequence)
        The SecurityModule returns the log message byte arrays wrapped in the SEQUENCE wrapper. That means, if the byte array that the SecurityModule gives to the TSEController is decoded into a TLVObject[], the first entry of that array will have the 0x30 Tag and it will have the rest of the log message byte array as its value. This is not what the TSEController or any other class needs to construct LogMessage. This method strips the SEQUENCE wrapper from the TLVObject[]. If the input does not begin with a UNIVERSAL SEQUENCE, it returns just the TLVObject[].
        Parameters:
        inputWithSequence - the TLVObject array that represents a LogMessage with the SEQUENCE wrapper.
        Returns:
        a TLVObject array without that SEQUENCE wrapper.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        TLVObject#decodeASN1ByteArrayToTLVObjectArray(byte[])}

      • byteArrayToString

        public static java.lang.String byteArrayToString(byte[] array)
        Converts the content of a byte array to a String in hexadecimal form.
        Parameters:
        array - the array one wants to convert to a human readable hexadecimal form
        Returns:
        the byte array in hexadecimal form for humans to read, without the "0x" prefix

      • byteArrayToBinaryString

        public static java.lang.String byteArrayToBinaryString(byte[] array)
        Converts the contents of a byte array to a String in binary form, leaving the leading zeroes intact.
        Parameters:
        array: - the array to be converted to a human readable binary form
        Returns:
        the byte array for humans to read in 8 substrings of 8 characters.

      • integerToByteArray_ASN1_Value

        public static byte[] integerToByteArray_ASN1_Value(int toBeConverted)
        Converts a value which is given as an Integer into a byte array according to the ASN1 DER standard.
        Parameters:
        toBeConverted -
        Returns:
        the byte array according to asn1 standards or "null", if the method fails.

      • longToByteArray_ASN1_Value

        public static byte[] longToByteArray_ASN1_Value(long toBeConverted)
        Converts a value which is given as a long into a byte array according to the ASN1 DER standard.
        Parameters:
        toBeConverted - a long to be converted
        Returns:
        a byte array representation of the long according to ASN1 DER standard.

      • asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger

        public static int asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[] asn1IntValue)
                                        throws ValueNullException,
                                               ValueTooBigException
        Converts an asn1 encoded value part of a TLV back to an integer, if possible. This is done via the java BigInteger class, through a temporary BigInteger object which is constructed from the content of the input array.
        Parameters:
        asn1IntValue - - the asn1 encoded integer value
        Returns:
        the int value decoded from the input array
        Throws:
        ValueNullException - if the input array is null
        ValueTooBigException - if the input array is longer than 4 bytes and its content can therefore not be stored in an int
        See Also:
        asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[]), ObjectIdentifier.convertTLVValueToOID(byte[])

      • asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong

        public static long asn1Value_ByteArrayToLong(byte[] asn1LongValue)
                                      throws ValueNullException,
                                             ValueTooBigException
        Converts an asn1 encoded value part of a TLV back to a long, if possible. This is done via the java BigInteger class, through a temporary BigInteger object which is constructed from the content of the input array.
        Parameters:
        asn1LongValue - - the asn1 encoded long value
        Returns:
        the long value decoded from the byte array
        Throws:
        ValueNullException - if the input array is null
        ValueTooBigException - if the input array is longer than 8 bytes and its content can therefore not be stored in a long
        See Also:
        asn1Value_ByteArrayToInteger(byte[]), ObjectIdentifier.convertTLVValueToOID(byte[])

      • isASN1_PrintableString

        public static boolean isASN1_PrintableString(java.lang.Object supposedPrintableString)
        Checks whether or not an Object is a ASN1 Printable String. To be used to check all the supposed printable String that are inputs from outside the TSE.
        Parameters:
        supposedPrintableString - the object that might be a printable string
        Returns:
        true, if the string representation of the object only contains characters permitted by the ASN1 definition of a printable string.
        false, otherwise, especially if the supposedPrintableString is null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isASN1_OctetString

        public static boolean isASN1_OctetString(java.lang.Object supposedOctetString)
        Checks whether or not an Object is an ASN1 OctetString. To be used to check all supposed octetc strings that are inputs from outside the TSE.
        Parameters:
        supposedOctetString - the object that might be an octet string
        Returns:
        true, if the supposedOctetString is of type Byte[] (This is the boxed version of the primitive byte[]) and the supposedOctetString is not null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isASN1_Integer

        public static boolean isASN1_Integer(java.lang.Object supposedInteger)
        Checks whether or not an Object is an ASN1 Integer. To be used to check all supposed integers that are inputs from outside the TSE. Does currently only accept Objects that can be boxed to Integer, Long, and BigInteger.
        Parameters:
        supposedInteger - the object that might be an integer
        Returns:
        true, if the supposedInteger is of type Integer, Long or BigInteger, and not null
        Since:
        1.0

      • isASN1_ObjectIdentifier

        public static boolean isASN1_ObjectIdentifier(java.lang.Object supposedOID)
        Checks whether or not an Object is an ASN1 ObjectIdentifier. To be used if at some point in time, OIDs are provided from outside of the TSE. In version 1.0 this only supports the following formats:

        {1 3 6 1 4 1}
        0.4.0.127.0.7.1.1.4.4.8
        urn:oid:1.3.6.1.4.1.123.0
        {iso(1) identified-organisation(3) dod(6) internet(1) private(4) enterprise(1)}

        This format is not recognized in version 1.0: { iso(1) member-body(2) 840 113549 }
        Parameters:
        supposedOID - - the supposedOID that is converted to a String and checked for compliance to one of the formats above.
        Returns:
        true, if the supposedOID can be converted into a String which conforms to one of the known OID formats, and is not null
